summary: Evelio Duque is a Cuban citizen who arrived in Quito, Ecuador, in 1966. He is mentioned in several cables related to anti-Castro activities and potential connections to drug trafficking. Documents suggest he met with drug trafficker Alfredo Ordonez Gonzalez in Central America. Station traces were requested on Duque, focusing on his involvement in exile groups. The documents indicate an interest in Duque's activities and potential links to both anti-Castro efforts and illicit drug trade.
significance: Evelio Duque's significance in the JFK context is primarily related to his potential involvement in anti-Castro activities and alleged connections to drug trafficking, which were areas of interest during investigations into possible motives and actors related to the assassination. The documents suggest that Duque was on the radar of intelligence agencies due to these activities, although a direct link to the JFK assassination is not explicitly stated in these documents.
